channel.title: Crazy dreams
channel.description:
We've all had them and will have many more But recently I've had some odd dreams probably due to me sleeping whenever I get the chance lol
So the cops were raiding us/me and they were different colors but too many green cops then they were all crayons and I had too many green crayons for the box God I hate dreams

item.title: Crazy dreams
item.dc:creator: @Svitkona Svitkona
item.description:
@Svitkona wrote:

-Nothing, I had that same dream a long time ago (it was sometime last year)… Iirc I was being crawled on by some spiders and I couldn’t move at all, then I felt something like an electric shock go through my body.

Edit: I just remembered another one, I met a woman in my home and I bent over to lick her vagina and suddenly I looked up and it was a man. The man told me he was my dad and that this was a test to see if I was gay. Then he walked away with his vagina dripping honey. I am not making this up.

Read full topic

item.title: Crazy dreams
item.dc:creator: @m1lkman m1lkman
item.description:
@m1lkman wrote:

I remember this one dream when I was Stu (stew?), the father from the Rugrats. He had to pee really bad. Then all of a sudden he started peeing and he felt a lot better. I woke up and my bed was soaked in piss. Happened like 4 years ago. I just remembered it now for some reason

Read full topic

I had a dream last night that it was snowing, I woke up and it actually was.

Was a very awkward moment when I woke up
[/quote]More like you had a wet dream.[/quote]He must of peed out gout crystals.

item.dc:creator: @krackkid Krackkid
item.description:

@m1lk no it was just a younger me sitting there shaking his head at my dead body in a casket. Scared me honestly.

item.title: Crazy dreams
item.dc:creator: @Acorn1 Acorn_
item.description:
@Acorn1 wrote:

[quote=“m1lkman, post:37, topic:433550”][quote author=krackkid link=topic=536270.msg3927813#msg3927813 date=1330389011]
I had a dream once of my funeral, only 1 person showed up and it was just me in the past o.o Very creepy looking at it.
[/quote]

WAz i there?

I had this one dream where i was running on the beach. I was a lifeguard. And then this alarm went off, like a siren or something. I woke up and it was my alarm making that sound. pretty cool.[/quote]
That alarm thing happens to me allot actually, although I find it irritating.

Read full topic

item.title: Crazy dreams
item.dc:creator: @Daginith Daginith
item.description:
@Daginith wrote:

[quote="-Nothing, post:33, topic:433550"][quote author=Acorn_ link=topic=536270.msg3924864#msg3924864 date=1330119163]

Not really a dream(?)
I slept on sofa when I was like 13-14 or so, then I woke up, and I was too sleepy to just wake up yet, and then I just kept staring at the sofa in front of me, but suddenly a very big tarantella runs on my face from the sofa, and I immediatly jumped up and started screaming like hell, but it wasn’t there, I still have no idea what happened, when I blinked my eyes I still could see the shadows of the spider(Like if you watch a bright light and look at wall and blink).

I’ve also had really weird ass dreams but I can’t remember them atm, might come post them later.

That would be the long term affects of abusing LSD.
[/quote]
I’ve never touched drugs in my life. It was long ago, but if I remember right I couldn’t move at all untill that spider jumped on my face.
I think this is it: http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sleep_paralysis

Hey, I found a story here just like mine : http://www.assap.ac.uk/newsite/articles/Mind.html
‘I woke up suddenly and saw a massive spider run across the top of my duvet and onto my pillow. I sat straight up in bed and shouted… Although I knew it wasn’t real [he has had a similar experience on a number of occasions] I still had to strip the bed back to its mattress and wake up my flat mate to check the room.’

EDIT:
I think I need to stop researching this, it’s driving me crazy… especially when I’m the type of person who believes in supernatural things. But what really reliefs me is that it was probably cause of lack of oxygen, I lived in my mothers house and the air there wasn’t so good, and it was so hot, I remember my mother also saying that I have symptoms of apnea.

Would be great if you guys shared similar experiences. After that happened I spent a month every night hoping it won’t happen again.[/quote]

Niggah, you waaay to paranoid. Get off of webMD, and stop thinkin’ about it, it will go away.

Read full topic

item.title: Crazy dreams
item.dc:creator: @Nothing1 -Nothing
item.description:
@Nothing1 wrote:

[quote=“Acorn_, post:31, topic:433550”][quote author=-Nothing link=topic=536270.msg3924453#msg3924453 date=1330067285]
Not really a dream(?)
I slept on sofa when I was like 13-14 or so, then I woke up, and I was too sleepy to just wake up yet, and then I just kept staring at the sofa in front of me, but suddenly a very big tarantella runs on my face from the sofa, and I immediatly jumped up and started screaming like hell, but it wasn’t there, I still have no idea what happened, when I blinked my eyes I still could see the shadows of the spider(Like if you watch a bright light and look at wall and blink).

I’ve also had really weird ass dreams but I can’t remember them atm, might come post them later.
[/quote]
That would be the long term affects of abusing LSD.[/quote]
I’ve never touched drugs in my life. It was long ago, but if I remember right I couldn’t move at all untill that spider jumped on my face.
I think this is it: http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sleep_paralysis

Hey, I found a story here just like mine : http://www.assap.ac.uk/newsite/articles/Mind.html
‘I woke up suddenly and saw a massive spider run across the top of my duvet and onto my pillow. I sat straight up in bed and shouted… Although I knew it wasn’t real [he has had a similar experience on a number of occasions] I still had to strip the bed back to its mattress and wake up my flat mate to check the room.’

EDIT:
I think I need to stop researching this, it’s driving me crazy… especially when I’m the type of person who believes in supernatural things. But what really reliefs me is that it was probably cause of lack of oxygen, I lived in my mothers house and the air there wasn’t so good, and it was so hot, I remember my mother also saying that I have symptoms of apnea.

Would be great if you guys shared similar experiences. After that happened I spent a month every night hoping it won’t happen again.

Read full topic

item.title: Crazy dreams
item.dc:creator: @KingoftheCastle KingoftheCastle
item.description:
@KingoftheCastle wrote:

ziplock:

You don’t know the meaning of crazy dreams until you’ve had sleep paralysis.

I have/had it for the past 10 years. I didn’t get into it because I figured its not really what I was talking about. And yeah, once you get used to it its not so bad. While were on that subject I also believe this is why people think they’ve been abducted by aliens lol. They be dumb

Read full topic

item.title: Crazy dreams
item.dc:creator: @Daginith Daginith
item.description:
@Daginith wrote:

Acorn_:

Fell asleep reading your comments, ended up having a dream inside of a dream that was inside of a bigger dream that was actually inside of a really small dream that jumped out of all the dreams and then went inside of a larger dream where I dream’t about a dream.

o.O. Did shit just go down? Or was that a dream inside a small dream, about a dream that never existed?

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @Acorn1 Acorn_

item.title: Crazy dreams
item.dc:creator: @KingoftheCastle KingoftheCastle
item.description:
@KingoftheCastle wrote:

RiiPiiNFtW:

Pretty sure that this was started before and was locked.

And now its unlocked. I was hoping low spam as I find dreams to be one of the most interesting parts of the mind.

I have a recurring dream where I’m in my house and people with guns are tying to get me so I have to try and escape. I never get shot lol but I always have this dream. And does anyone ever drive or ride something then it just turns into something else hahaha. I’m in a corvette or something then its a four wheeler. Wtf?

Read full topic
